API: Processing (YOLOv8 & Motion)¶

The processing pipeline that extracts keypoints and calculates metrics from video frames.

Video Processing Pipeline

Real frame-by-frame processing for Parkinson’s motion analysis:

  • Pose keypoint detection (17 points via YOLOv8-Pose / TensorRT)

  • Motion detection between frames

  • Tremor analysis (nose jitter)

All metrics are computed from actual frame data using YOLOv8-Pose on GPU.

class processing.BagFileReader(bag_path: str)[source]¶

Bases: object

Read frames from a RealSense BAG file. Provides an iterator interface similar to cv2.VideoCapture.

get(prop: int)[source]¶

Mimic cv2.VideoCapture.get() for common properties.

isOpened() → bool[source]¶
read() → Tuple[bool, ndarray | None][source]¶

Read next frame, returns (success, frame) like cv2.VideoCapture.

release()[source]¶

Stop pipeline and cleanup.

processing.analyze_tremor_yolo(history: list) → float[source]¶

Simple tremor detection based on Nose X/Y movement variance (jitter).

processing.calculate_keypoint_motion(prev_landmarks: dict, curr_landmarks: dict) → dict[source]¶

Calculate motion between two frames based on YOLO keypoint positions.

Returns:

Dictionary with total, average, and max motion across tracked keypoints.

processing.cancel_job(job_id: str) → bool[source]¶

Cancel a processing job.

processing.check_job_cancelled(job_id: str) → bool[source]¶

Check if job was cancelled.

processing.create_processing_job(batch_id: str, has_cam1: bool, has_cam2: bool) → str[source]¶

Create a new processing job.

Parameters:

  • batch_id – Video batch ID

  • has_cam1 – Whether camera 1 file exists

  • has_cam2 – Whether camera 2 file exists

Returns:

Job ID

processing.extract_yolo_landmarks(results)[source]¶

Extract pose keypoints from YOLOv8-Pose results.

YOLO Pose returns 17 keypoints per person. Indices: 0:Nose, 1:L-Eye, 2:R-Eye, 3:L-Ear, 4:R-Ear

Returns:

Dictionary with named keypoint groups, or None if no person detected.

processing.get_all_jobs() → list[source]¶

Get all processing jobs.

processing.get_job(job_id: str) → dict[source]¶

Get processing job by ID.

processing.is_batch_processing(batch_id: str) → tuple[source]¶

Check if batch is already being processed.

processing.process_video(job_id: str, camera_num: int, batch_id: str)[source]¶

Process a video file with real frame-by-frame analysis.

Processing Pipeline:

  1. Load video and metadata

  2. Apply warm color filter to each frame

  3. Calculate per-frame metrics (brightness, color, edges)

  4. Calculate inter-frame motion

  5. Detect tremor patterns from motion history

  6. Aggregate all metrics into final report

Parameters:

  • job_id – Processing job identifier

  • camera_num – Camera number (1 or 2)

  • batch_id – Video batch ID (timestamp prefix)

processing.update_job_progress(job_id: str, camera_num: int, progress: int, step_name: str)[source]¶

Update processing job progress.
